units.title: Tissue cleaning and crypt isolation
units.text: To clean the tissue and isolate fresh crypts for organoid generation, colon tissue was first sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientific) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish filled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 10 mM HEPES (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X GlutaMAX (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X Pen-Strep (Thermo Fisher Scientific), and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B (Thermo Fisher Scientific)). The epithelium was then minced from tissue segments using scalpels (Fisher Scientific) and collected into 50 mL conical tubes. Minced epithelium was washed 3 times with DMEM++ (Advanced DMEM/F12 (Thermo Fisher Scientific) supplemented with 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X Pen-Strep, and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B), and centrifuged at 4 °C, 500 × g for 3 min.
units.rationale: Describes the initial processing steps to obtain viable crypts from human colon tissue.

units.title: EDTA digestion to release crypts
units.text: After the final wash, tissue was resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end-over-end rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12 min.
units.rationale: Specifies the enzymatic digestion conditions that liberate crypt structures.

units.title: Embedding crypts in Matrigel and initial media
units.text: Once Matrigel had solidified for 30 min at 37 °C, crypts were fed with organoid growth media65: Advanced DMEM/F12 supplemented with 1X Pen-Strep, 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X B-27 Supplement, 0.2 nM Wnt Surrogate protein, 5 nM Gastrin-1, 1.25mM N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine, 10 mM Nicotinamide, 100 µg/mL Primocin, 500 nM A 83-01, 50 ng/mL recombinant human EGF, 100 ng/mL recombinant human Noggin, 250 ng/mL recombinant human R-spondin 3, 100 ng/mL recombinant human IGF1, 50 ng/mL recombinant human FGF2, and 10 µM Y-27632.
units.rationale: Provides the composition of the growth medium and embedding step for establishing organoid cultures.

units.title: Organoid passaging procedure
units.text: To passage, organoids were mechanically dislodged from Cultrex domes using a P1000 pipette tip and resuspended in cold 10 mM EDTA with 10 µM Y-27632 (STEMCELL Technologies) in a 15 mL conical tube. The tube containing organoids was then placed on an end-over-end rotator at 4 °C for 30 min and then centrifuged for 5 min at 500 ×g, 4 °C.
units.rationale: Outlines the mechanical and chemical steps for splitting organoid cultures.

units.title: Gamma irradiation injury protocol
units.text: For irradiation studies, the plates were placed on the center of the rotating table of the (137Cs) gamma irradiator) for the time periods equivalent to either 6 Gy or 12 Gy, and then the organoids were further cultured in the incubator.
units.rationale: Details the exposure conditions used to induce radiation injury in organoids.

units.title: DSS chemical injury protocol
units.text: For DSS treatment, DSS (MP Biomedicals) was dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media.
units.rationale: Describes the dextran sulfate sodium exposure used to model chemical injury.

units.title: Cytokine (cytomix) injury protocol
units.text: For cytomix treatment, human recombinant TNFɑ (R&D Systems), IFNɣ (R&D systems), and IL-1β (PeproTech) were dissolved in organoid media and organoids were cultured every 5–7 days as needed based on size and morphology.
units.rationale: Specifies the cytokine cocktail and application schedule for inflammatory injury.

units.title: FITC‑dextran permeability assay
units.text: FITC-Dextran (MedChemExpress) diluted to 2 mg/mL in PBS for 5 min in the incubator (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 30 min, after which organoid in µ-slides (Ibidi) to allow organoids to settle to the bottom of the slide chamber.
units.rationale: Provides the steps for assessing barrier integrity via fluorescent dextran uptake.

units.title: Caspase‑3/7 apoptosis detection assay
units.text: For apoptosis quantification, organoids were incubated in CellEvent Caspase-3/7 Detection Reagent (Thermo Fisher) diluted in media according to manufacturer protocols for 30 min, washed with PBS and imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal.
units.rationale: Describes the fluorescent caspase assay used to measure cell death.

units.title: Whole‑mount immunofluorescence staining
units.text: For immunofluorescent images, organoids were removed from the microwell plates and fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde (Thermo Fisher) overnight at 4 °C on a rocker.
units.rationale: Outlines the fixation step preceding immunostaining of organoids.
